author: Tobias Baughman

review: Easy to setup with an added bonus that you can sideload apps not found on the store site like XBMC. I have an Apple TV 2nd Gen and have found the Fire TV to be a significant improvement in speed, access to additional apps and program content. The UI is easy to use and as long as you are a Prime member and can grin and bear not having access to HBO, Sky and AMC, you will be very happy with your choice.Shortcomings are that since the remote is Bluetooth, you can't use a universal remote to control it, so there is no backup if you need one-especially since for some dumb reason, somebody thought it would be fine to release the product without a mobile phone app to control it. It also means you are stuck with more than one remote on your table since it doesn't control sound volume which also seems like a major oversight.
